channel.title: New Graphics Card
channel.description:
OK I'm buying a new computer and I need to get a new graphics card, my budget is max $130 CDN. As I'm buying my computer at tigerdirect, preferably the card would too (less shipping). So [url=http://www.tigerdirect.ca/applications/category/category_slc.asp?Sort=4&Nav=|c:28|lp:100:hp:199.99|&Recs=30]take your pick[/url] and post.
I'm liking the looks of the [url=http://www.tigerdirect.ca/applications/SearchTools/item-details.asp?EdpNo=4893208&CatId=28]EVGA GeForce 9800 GTX[/url] but I'm also thinking I'd like to try an ATI card such as the [url=http://www.tigerdirect.ca/applications/SearchTools/item-details.asp?EdpNo=4348739&CatId=28]Diamond Radeon HD 4670[/url].
My current card is an 8400GS btw, total POS.

item.title: New Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Awesome, I’ll buy it then.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 24 September 2009, 06:49pm[/size][hr]OK I bought a 4870, arrived today. The card itself is pretty massive, I had to move my hdd out of the way for it to fit. I’ve been playing Crysis on very high, 8x AA at 1680x1050 with no signs of lag whatsoever. This card is fucking beast for $180.

Read full topic

item.description:

Its the same thing, different brand…

I think HIS is a better company.

item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

So this thing has been out of stock for a while, is this one pretty much equivalent? It doesn’t have dual DVI, which is fine (my current card doesn’t), and it has an HDMI port!

item.title: New Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

Get the 4850 for $99 bucks.

newegg.com

PowerColor Radeon HD 4850 DirectX 10.1 AX4850 512MD3-PH 512MB 256-Bit GDDR3 PCI...

Buy PowerColor Radeon HD 4850 DirectX 10.1 AX4850 512MD3-PH 512MB 256-Bit GDDR3 PCI Express 2.0 x16 HDCP Ready CrossFireX Support Video Card with fast shipping and top-rated customer service.Once you know, you Newegg!

It even has a native HDMI port.

Read full topic

item.title: New Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

mwiebelhaus:

hm really? then your badly mistaken I can play battlefield 2 at 1024x768 just fine

OK that’s like 200 more pixels. My point being, you will never be able to play games at native screen resolution, 1680x1050, 1980x1080 or whatever, without a real graphics card.

Read full topic

item.title: New Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Unhandled:

Yeah no shit it’s for gaming…I’m running 1680x1050 and 1280x1024 (dual monitors) on my 8400 GS atm, no problems. I doubt you would ever get beyond 800x600 for a game like CoD4 or even BF2 with your integrated card.

hm really? then your badly mistaken I can play battlefield 2 at 1024x768 just fine

Read full topic

item.title: New Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote author=sanga282 link=topic=394911.msg2936086#msg2936086 date=1251568775]
get a bigger budge gdamn it
[/quote[quote=“xEnt, post:11, topic:298514”]in your pricerange, the GTS250 OC is what you want a good 450w or average 550w will handle it. If you can bump it up 40$ more, it’s well worth getting this: http://www.tigerdirect.ca/applications/SearchTools/item-details.asp?EdpNo=4833007&CatId=28

if your going to be using resolutions of 1680x1050+ highly recommend getting the 1gb 4870, good brand too.

ps 4670 ain’t that good, not even sure why its that expensive??[/quote]

Myabe for gaming? But I use 1980X1080 with my intel integratedcard and it works just fine.

Read full topic

item.title: New Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:11, topic:298514”]in your pricerange, the GTS250 OC is what you want a good 450w or average 550w will handle it. If you can bump it up 40$ more, it’s well worth getting this: http://www.tigerdirect.ca/applications/SearchTools/item-details.asp?EdpNo=4833007&CatId=28

if your going to be using resolutions of 1680x1050+ highly recommend getting the 1gb 4870, good brand too.

ps 4670 ain’t that good, not even sure why its that expensive??[/quote]

Well I think I’ll just be getting the barebones kit now, and a card in a month or so, cause mum is raging about the price. In that case, I might as well go with the 4870. I’ve never played beyond 1280x900 on my 22", going to be fucking sweet to play at 1680x1050!

Read full topic

item.title: New Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

in your pricerange, the GTS250 OC is what you want a good 450w or average 550w will handle it. If you can bump it up 40$ more, it’s well worth getting this: http://www.tigerdirect.ca/applications/SearchTools/item-details.asp?EdpNo=4833007&CatId=28

if your going to be using resolutions of 1680x1050+ highly recommend getting the 1gb 4870, good brand too.

ps 4670 ain’t that good, not even sure why its that expensive??

Read full topic

item.title: New Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

Unhandled:

Wow chrisn2323 I wasn’t aware I could get a 200 series for that price! The GTS 250 has higher clock speeds for core and memory than the 4850, so I think I may go with that one. What kind of PSU should I be looking at? The barebones kit I’m getting comes with a 450W, and I have a 465W hanging around, will I be needing to pick up a 500W+?

doubt you would need more

Read full topic

item.title: New Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @Ryanz Ryanz
item.description:
@Ryanz wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:7, topic:298514”]Wow chrisn2323 I wasn’t aware I could get a 200 series for that price! The GTS 250 has higher clock speeds for core and memory than the 4850, so I think I may go with that one. What kind of PSU should I be looking at? The barebones kit I’m getting comes with a 450W, and I have a 465W hanging around, will I be needing to pick up a 500W+?[/quote]Buy the ones Chrisn2323 linked you to, otherwise buy the GeForce 9800.
